wikipedia_page.main: Vice Admiral Richard Bell Davies,  (19 May 1886 – 26 February 1966), also known as Richard Bell-Davies, was a senior Royal Navy commander, naval aviator, and a First World War recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

link_mentions.page: Assistant Chief of the Naval Staff (Aviation, Amphibious Capability & Carriers)
response: * Rear Admiral Richard Bell-Davies: 24 May 1939 – 30 September 1941
